abstract: Former New Orleans Police Officers Kenneth Bowen, Robert Gisevius, Anthony Villavaso, Robert Faulcon and Arthur Kaufman plead guilty to conspiracy, obstruction of justice and civil rights charges in connection with shooting of unarmed citizens in aftermath of Hurricane Katrina; men will serve prison sentences of three to 12 years, according to their plea agreements.

headline.print_headline: New Orleans Officers Plead Guilty in Civilian Shootings After Hurricane
headline.main: New Orleans Police Officers Plead Guilty in Shooting of Civilians

snippet: The five former officers were charged after six unarmed people were shot, two fatally, on the Danziger Bridge in the chaos after Hurricane Katrina.
lead_paragraph: The five former officers were charged after six unarmed people were shot, two fatally, on the Danziger Bridge in the chaos after Hurricane Katrina.
